channel.title: Do you download music "illegally"?
channel.description:
Do you download your music illegally?
How do you obtain music, itunes, utorrent, zume?
Favorite type of music?
Please if you don't, tell me what you do, or if you even listen to music, and none of those "lol why would you download music and not want to pay a buck for a song!?"

oh didnt knaw

Read full topic

[quote=“xEnt, post:42, topic:345206”][quote author=Javafire link=topic=441583.msg3243752#msg3243752 date=1277160914]
No anti virus = Need life lock cause your credit is gonna be history from all the trojans and keyloggers you probably have.

I get my stuff from websites, and most of the time i just get it as kihomura has, except i use warerocker sometimes

Here is part of my extensive music library( and no I do not use stardock i use customise.org/xpthemes thank you very much :P)

[/quote]

rise against, sum 41. i like your style.[/quote][quote=“pure2ownage, post:43, topic:345206”]only if he didnt download the same song like 3 times[/quote]

  1. Thnx man
  2. That was because i transfered the files from a corrupt external hard drive two of them are messed up formats

item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“Javafire, post:10, topic:345206”][quote author=jmood128 link=topic=441583.msg3243736#msg3243736 date=1277160064]
You guys fail…

I use Lime Wire, I haven’t gotten 1 virus.
[/quote] I use McAfee you use avg, big difference bro. They pour out TONS of viruses into their free version unofficially through other people. So don’t go there man i learned my lesson years ago[/quote]

Only if you don’t know how to use it properly…

I use torrents for big downloads for discographies and single albums, Limewire when I just want one or two songs.

item.title: Do you download music "illegally"?
item.dc:creator: @T3arful T3arful
item.description:
@T3arful wrote:

http://www.warez-bb.org/index.php I have downloaded roughly 31gb of music from links posted on that site and have never had a problem.

I don’t use stuff like Limewire or The Pirate Bay (torrents basically) because of the risk of being caught by my ISP (happened once). It’s a lot safer to use the huge file hosting sites because there isn’t a risk of your IP being tracked and reported. Also the file hosting sites are a lot faster when it comes to downloading, so I don’t have to wait ages like on torrents.

Frell:

Apple just needs to make a custom music format for the ipod and then problem solved.

Yes problem solved for about a week or so until someone finds out how to convert other audio files into their format.

[quote=“noobs are ftw, post:24, topic:345206”][quote author=Javafire link=topic=441583.msg3243801#msg3243801 date=1277163729]

i use limewire lol

try not to, HUGE virus risk in using that, either use frostwire (like 5% more secure). or soulseek, or realplayer
[/quote]

frostwire has more viruses man[/quote]
I’m pretty sure that Frostwire and Limewire both grab the same torrent links… so essentially they’d be the same. Neither of those two clients have viruses, but there is obviously going to be some dodgy content you can download, which is the case all over the internet.

TabbyKiller:

I use javascript on youtube. O for awesome

Cool enjoy your 128kbs sound quality

Read full topic
